title.narrative: Building Resilient Coffee Communities in Colombia (BUILD)

description.narrative: Reliable access to land and sustainable management of watersheds is essential for rural communities that depend on growing coffee and food crops to survive. Through the BUILD Program, Mercy Corps with the support of our implementing partner the Cooperative of Coffee Growers in Southern Tolima, Colombia (CAFISUR) will help rural communities address their most urgent poverty issues by helping farmers secure land ownership, improve water and land management practices, and grow nutritious foods that will improve food security and diversify economic opportunities for their families and their communities. This approach mirrors Mercy Corps’ global agriculture development strategy which focuses on three interrelated priorities: building sustainable incomes, improving food security and nutrition, and creating more resilient communities.

Southern Tolima.
Obj 1: Formalize property rights for 150 families with an emphasis on improving access to land for women and youth.
Obj 2: Improve water and land management practices amongst 920 coffee growing families to ensure better access to clean water and more sustainable management of water for consumption and agricultural purposes.
Obj 3: Increase the availability of nutrient rich food for 700 coffee growing families.
